io.github.zachohara.imagecomparator.gui

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • io.github.zachohara.imagecomparator.gui.Window
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Window
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    A Window is a JFrame that acts as the main interface between the program's functionality and the user.
    Author:
    Zach Ohara
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      The size of the text that is displayed as the title of the selection screen.

      The panel that extends over the top of the selection screen, and only contains the title text.

      The text that is displayed at the top of the selection screen; not to be confused with the window title.

    • Field Detail

      • isWaitingForSelection

        private volatile boolean isWaitingForSelection
        The loading/waiting status of this window. true if this window is currently waiting for user action, or false if this window is currently loading.

      • selection

        private java.lang.String selection
        The last selection that the user made.

    • Method Detail

      • handleWindowResize

        public void handleWindowResize()
        Resizes all elements inside the window according to the current window size. This method is called after the window is resized by the user.

      • getChoice

        public java.lang.String getChoice()
        Pauses until the user makes a descision for the current prompt, then returns that descision.
        Returns:
        the user descision for the current prompt.

      • setLoadingText

        public void setLoadingText(java.lang.String text)
        Changes the text that is displayed above the progress bar in the loading screen.
        Parameters:
        text - the text that should be displayed in the loading screen.

      • setIsLoading

        public void setIsLoading(boolean loading)
        Changes between the loading screen and the selection screen being shown.
        Parameters:
        loading - true if the loading screen should be displayed, or false if the selection screen should be displayed.

      • handleButtonPress

        public void handleButtonPress(java.lang.String button)
        Determines what to do when a button is pressed in the GUI.
        Parameters:
        button - the name of the button that was pressed.

      • setImages

        public void setImages(Image left,
                      Image right)
        Changes the prompt screen to show a set of two images.
        Parameters:
        left - the Image that should display on the left side.
        right - the Image that should display on the right side.
